intro: Prestonia megalagrion, commonly known as the giant prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
